title: SpaceX lands on potential date for next Starship test flight
summary: SpaceX has landed on a potential date for its next Starship test flight: March 14. Starship is SpaceX’s massive rocket that will...

title: New congressional caucus seeks to build support for NASA’s planetary science programs
summary: As NASA’s planetary science programs face reduced budgets this year and uncertain prospects for next year, advocates in Congress are banding together to build up support for them.

title: Planet Labs gets U.S. Navy contract for maritime surveillance in the Pacific
summary: The company’s satellite imagery will be used for vessel detection and monitoring by the Naval Information Warfare Center Pacific

title: Rhea Space Activity to fly navigation payloads on lunar lander mission
summary: A company developing cislunar navigation systems has won a grant to test its technology on an upcoming commercial lunar lander mission.

title: The next Starship mission has a tentative launch date: March 14
summary: This third flight has a reasonable chance of success.

title: Launch the ORBITS Act
summary: The Senate unanimously passed the ORBITS Act for the second time, signaling that it's time to take orbital debris seriously.

title: Thaicom orders small GEO satellite from Astranis for a launch in 2025
summary: Thaicom has ordered a small geostationary satellite from Astranis for a launch in 2025 to provide broadband to some of the most remote and unconnected areas in Asia.

title: China outlines position on use of space resources
summary: China holds a seemingly positive stance towards the use of space resources, according to a recent submission made by a Chinese delegation to the United Nations.

title: Exotrail deploys first satellite from orbital transfer vehicle
summary: Exotrail announced March 6 it has successfully deployed a satellite from its first spacevan orbital transfer vehicle.

title: House To Take Up FY2024 Appropriations for NASA, NOAA, FAA on Wednesday
summary: House Speaker Mike Johnson has scheduled House consideration of the first package of FY2024 appropriations bills tomorrow, March 6.  The collection of six bills, called a “minibus,” includes Commerce-Justice-Science that […]
